Introduction.Name: Lizardmen
Introduction.Annotation: The Lizardmen, sometimes known as the Cold Ones or the Children of the Gods, are an ancient, savage, intelligent race of cold-blooded, reptilian humanoids that were at one time the first and oldest civilisation of the Warhammer World. Long before the rise of Men, Elf or Dwarf, the empire of the Lizardmen ruled supreme.\n\nAlien, enigmatic, and without mercy, the Lizardmen were there when it all began and will be there when the world draws its last dying breath, never tiring nor relenting until order is finally restored to this uncaring, chaotic world. Such is what they were made to do, for they are the ancient servants of the Old Ones, the one true protectors of this very world.

Magic.Name: The Lore of Heaven
Magic.Alternative: Any of eight Lore of Battle Magic

Artefact.Name: Blessed Spawning of Tzunki
Artefact.Rule: Aquatic
Artefact.Description: Aquatic, +1 Initiative.

Artefact.Name: Blessed Spawning of Sotek
Artefact.Description: When the unit/character charges, they get +1 Attack for that round of combat.

Artefact.Name: Blessed Spawning of Quetzl
Artefact.Description: Scaly Skin save increased by +1.

Artefact.Name: Blessed Spawning of Tlazcotl
Artefact.Description: Immune to Psychology (note that a Carnosaur ridden by a Saurus Oldblood with the Blessed Spawning of Tlazcotl is still subject to Blood-Frenzy, and Cold Ones will still be subject to stupidity).

Artefact.Name: Blessed Spawning of Chotec
Artefact.Rule: Roll an extra dice when pursuing and choose the highest two (or three if mounted)
Artefact.Description: Roll an extra dice when pursuing and choose the highest two (or three if mounted).

Artefact.Name: Blessed Spawning of Huanchi
Artefact.Rule: May move through jungle, woods and forest as if it were open ground, suffering no penalties for movement
Artefact.Description: The unit may move through jungle, woods and forest as if it were open ground, suffering no penalties for movement.

Artefact.Name: Blessed Spawning of Tepok
Artefact.Description: The presence of the unit or character on the battlefield adds one dice to the player's Dispel dice pool.

Artefact.Name: Blessed Spawning of Itzl
Artefact.Description: Characters must take the Blessed Spawning of Itzl if they wish to ride a Cold One or a Carnosaur.

Artefact.Name: Blessed Mark of the Old Ones
Artefact.Rule: May re-roll a total of D3 single D6's per game
Artefact.Description: The character may re-roll a total of D3 (roll at the start of the game) single D6's per game. Each re-roll entitles the player to take a single D6 of his own that directly effects the character (including one of the dice rolled as part of a 2D6, 3D6, etc) and roll it again. This can potentially cause Irresistible Force or avoid a Miscast. Remember that you cannot re-roll a dice more than once.

Artefact.Name: Cupped Hands of the Old Ones
Artefact.Description: The entire unit that is accompanying the Slann gains a 5+ Ward save. Note, however, that the unit does not get this increase against models that are attacking it in close combat, for they are slightiy inside the mystical shield.

Artefact.Name: The Divine Plaque of Protection
Artefact.Rule: Ward save 2+, but not for close combat
Artefact.Description: Increases the Ward save that the Slann gets from 4+ to 2+. Note however, that the Slann does not get this increase against models that are attacking it in close combat, for they are slighdy inside the mystical shield. In close combat, the Slann still only gets a 4+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: Plaque of Dominion
Artefact.Description: Adds an extra +1 dice to the Lizsmdmen player's Power dice and Dispel pools.

Artefact.Name: Plaque of Tepok
Artefact.Rule: Knows one more spell than he is normally allowed
Artefact.Description: The Slann knows one more spell than he is normally allowed.

Artefact.Name: Blade of Revered Tzanuki
Artefact.Description: +1 Strenght. No armour saves are allowed against attacks made by the Blade of Revered Tzanuki

Artefact.Name: Scimitar of the Sun Resplendent
Artefact.Description: The wielder of this blade has +2 Attacks

Artefact.Name: Staff of the Lost Sun
Artefact.Rule: 3 shots, Strength of 5
Artefact.Description: The staff is treated as a short bow that has a Strenght of 5, and 3x Multiple Shots

Artefact.Name: Piranha Blade
Artefact.Description: Any unsaved wound inflicted by the Piranha Blade is multipled into two wounds

Artefact.Name: Blade of Realities
Artefact.Rule: Any wound inflicted on Daemons is multiplied into two wounds
Artefact.Description: No Ward saves are allowed against the Blade of Realities, although Armour saves and Regeneration may be taken as normal. In addition, any wound inflicted on Daemons is multiplied into two wounds (after Armour saves, etc)

Artefact.Name: Dagger of Sotek
Artefact.Description: Confers on the bearer the killing blow ability. In addition, the bearer causes Fear in Skaven

Artefact.Name: Sword of the Hornet
Artefact.Description: The bearer of this sword has the 'Always Strikes First' rule. If an opponent also has the ability to always strike first then resolve their attacks in normal Initiative order.

Artefact.Name: Burning Blade of Chotec
Artefact.Rule: Flaming attacks
Artefact.Description: Targets struck by the Burning Blade of Chotec suffer a -2 penalty to their Armour save in addition to any modifiers from the user's Strength. All attacks made with this weapon count as flaming attacks.

Artefact.Name: Sacred Stegadon Helm
Artefact.Description: Confers +1 to the model's Armour save, which may be combined with other armour as normal. In addition, the helm adds +1 to the model's Leadership

Artefact.Name: Shield of the Mirrored Pool
Artefact.Rule: Magic missile reflected on 2+
Artefact.Description: The shield confers a +1 Armour save like a normal shield. In addition, any magic missile that strikes the bearer or any unit he is with is deflected on the roll of 4+ on a D6. If the spell is deflected, the results of the magic missile is resolved against the caster of the spell or the unit the character is with (following the normal targeting rules). This in turn cannot be dispelled.

Artefact.Name: The Mainming Shield
Artefact.Description: The shield confers a +1 Armour save like a normal shield. In addition, it confers +1 Attack to the model using it. This additional attack is worked out using the base Strength of the wielder, and counts as magical.

Artefact.Name: Gleaming Pendant of Chotec
Artefact.Rule: For one turn, enemy unit that is in contact with the model using the pendant will strike last in combat, one use only
Artefact.Description: One use only. The pendant may be used at the start of any Lizardmen player's Close Combat phase. For that turn only, any enemy unit that is in contact with the model using the pendant will strike last in combat - even striking after great weapons and Zombies! If an enemy has the ability to always strike first, then on the roll of a 4+ they get to attack first; if they roll a 1-3, then they too will strike last.

Artefact.Name: Blood Statuette of Spite
Artefact.Description: Bounded Spell. Power Level 5. One use only. Once per game, the user may cast the spell bound within the statuette. The spell may be cast on any enemy character. That character must immediately take Toughness test. If this test is failed, then the model loses a Wound with no armour saves allowed. If the model takes a wound, it must immediately take another Toughness test, losing another wound if it fails again. This continues until either the model passes a Toughness test or is slain

Artefact.Name: Cloak of Feathers
Artefact.Rule: Fly
Artefact.Description: The wearer of the cloack may fly

Artefact.Name: Charm of the Jaguar Warrior
Artefact.Description: The model's Movement is increased to 9.

Artefact.Name: Curse-Charm of Tepok
Artefact.Rule: Enemy mage re-rolls Miscast, one use only
Artefact.Description: After the enemy rolls on the Miscast Table for the first time in the game, the bearer of the Curse-Charm of Tepok may force their opponent to re-roll the result. This second result stands.

Artefact.Name: Bane Head
Artefact.Rule: Unsaved wounds doubled for nominated target
Artefact.Description: Nominate an enemy character at the start of the battle. All unsaved wounds caused by the bearer on the nominated target are doubled

Artefact.Name: Dragonfly of Quicksilver
Artefact.Rule: +1 to Scout deploys
Artefact.Description: If both players have models with the Scout ability, the Lizardmen player adds 1 to his dice roll when rolling to see eho deploys their Scouts first

Artefact.Name: Venom of the Firefly Frog
Artefact.Description: All mundane weapons used by the model with the Venom of the Firefly Frog (both close combat weapons and ranged weapons) are coated with this venom. All attacks made with these weapons count as Poisoned Attacks and are magical.

Artefact.Name: Rode of the Storm
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell, Power Level 5: magic missile that inflicts 2D6 automatic Strength 3 hits (Strength 4 if the target has an Armour save of 4+ or better) on one enemy unit within 18", one use only
Artefact.Description: Bound Spell. Power Level 5. One use only. May be targeted against an enemy unit during the Magic phase. It is a magic missile that inflicts 2D6 automatic Strength 3 hits (Strength 4 if the target has an Armour save of 4+ or better) on one enemy unit within 18". In addition, any unit that suffers wounds from the rod must take an immediate Panic test.

Artefact.Name: Cube of Darkness
Artefact.Rule: One spell dispell, all Ramains in Play spells are dispelled, magic phase ends immediately on the roll of a 4+, one use only
On 4+
Artefact.Description: One use only. This may be used with the exact same effects as a Dispel Scroll. In addition, all Remains in Play spells are automaticaUy removed from play. Finally, roll a D6. The Magic phase ends immediately on the roll of a 4+.

Artefact.Name: Diadem of power
Artefact.Rule: Two power dice save for dispel
Artefact.Description: The diadem allows the bearer to save up to two of his own unused Power dice or Dispel dice at the end of any Magic phase and store them, to add to his side's dice pool in the next Magic phase.

Artefact.Name: Amulet of Itza
Artefact.Description: One use only. The character wearing this amulet has a 2+ ward save against the first wound suffered.

Artefact.Name: Aura of Quetzl
Artefact.Rule: 4+ Ward save against attacks with Strength 5 or more
Artefact.Description: The bearer of this item has a 4+ Ward save against attacks with Strength 5 or more.

Artefact.Name: Glyph Necklace
Artefact.Description: The character wearing this gains a 5+ ward save

Artefact.Name: Totem of Prophecy
Artefact.Description: The unit causes Fear

Artefact.Name: Sun Standart of Chotec
Artefact.Rule: Missles fired at the unit suffer -1 to Hit
Artefact.Description: Missles fired at the unit suffer -1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Huanchi's Blessed Totem
Artefact.Rule: Once +D6" to charge
Artefact.Description: One use only. The unit may use this banner once per game, at the start of any Lizardmen Magic phase. The unit moves direcdy forwards yp to D6". If it runs into an enemy unit, it counts as charging in the next Close Combat phase. The enemy may not make any charge reaction.

Artefact.Name: Jaguar Standard
Artefact.Rule: Pursues an extra D6"
Artefact.Description: The unit pursues an extra D6"

Individual.Rule: The Spirit of venerable Lord Kroak
Ward save 2+, but not in close combat
Extra dice for any spell cast, this dice not come from Power poll and is in affect a 'free' dice
+2 to all attempts to cast and dispell
Strength 5 hit for any wound inflicted

RangeWeapon.Name: Hands of Gods
RangeWeapon.Rule: D6 Strength 4 hits within 8", no Armour saves allowed

Option.Name: Fourth Generation
Option.Rule: No roll on the Miscast Table

Option.Name: Third Generation
Option.Rule: No roll on the Miscast Table

Option.Name: Second Generation
Option.Rule: No roll on the Miscast Table
Extra dice for any spell cast, this dice not come from Power poll and is in affect a 'free' dice
